conclusion: Analyzing whether the elevator is in a state of weightlessness or overload at t=4.5s by examining the acceleration graph.
The graph shows acceleration (a) in m/s² versus time (t) in seconds. The vertical axis represents acceleration, and the horizontal axis represents time.
At t=4.5s, the acceleration appears to be 0 m/s² as the graph is crossing the time axis.

Weightlessness occurs when the apparent weight of an object becomes zero, happening when net acceleration equals acceleration due to gravity (a = -g). Overload occurs when apparent weight exceeds normal weight, happening when acceleration is upward or downward acceleration is less than g.
At t=4.5s, acceleration is 0 m/s², meaning the elevator is not accelerating and passengers experience normal weight.
Final answer: At t=4.5s, the elevator is neither in a state of weightlessness nor overload.
